channel.title: Using the UID

item.description:
@mod_cody wrote:

Just use the same UID for all the clients no need for seperate ones…

item.title: Using the UID
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

if (clientuid != Id) { returnCode = whatever; }

Uid’s aren’t secure though, may as well use a different way to see if they’re connecting through the correct client or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Using the UID
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

okay, for my client i have it set to a normal uid
and i was wondering if i culd make it use a dif-
ferent code for each client

example:
public void TEST() {
if(UID == (my clients secret uid)) {
custom client only code here
} else if (UID !=(NUMBER)) {
non client code here
}

wuld that work?

Read full topic
